definition: to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: Li Busu was familiar with the route so they made rapid progress. He turned this way and that through open crevices .
sentences.chinese: 李不俗驾轻就熟，在那些嵌裂透漏的缝隙中钻来转去。

sentences.english: Can you shed some light on the Emerson controversy?
sentences.chinese: 在关于与埃默森的争吵上你能否透漏一些信息？

sentences.english: You always give away the endings!
sentences.chinese: 你每次都把结局透漏出来。

sentences.english: The woman, whose name was not released, had earlier been involved in a domestic dispute.
sentences.chinese: 官方尚未透漏该位母亲姓名，她之前发生了家庭争吵。

sentences.english: The operational use of the drones has never been described by official sources.
sentences.chinese: 美国官方人士对隐形机的使用从未透漏任何消息。

sentences.english: There were bags under their eyes. Their voices never rose.
sentences.chinese: 明显的眼袋和低沉的说话声透漏出失望的心境。

sentences.english: According to Emmons, most doors leak air.
sentences.chinese: 据埃蒙斯谈，大多数的门都透漏空气。

definition: to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc

pinyin: xiao1 xi5 ling2 tong1 ren2 shi4

definition: to pass on/to convey/to relay/to transmit/transmission
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
